Comment: Means 'which is above the totality of all our hands'.
Means both hands and both feet.

Means 'where the sun enters'; see previous entry.
Respectively: refers to fruit or crop; refers to substances such as water, etc.

'sɨpepe is a kind of cactus with a round shape, that gives the idea of turning around.
Means 'make the way, show the way'.
Respectively: 'let go, set free; make fall'.
Respectively: 'let go, set free; make fall'.
From Old Guaraní kuare poti '(arse) hole excrement' (04.660). A Jesuitic depreciative creation!
Means: 'what is for the top of the house'.
First ex. means 'home, room'; the house as a building is t-ẽta, r-ẽta, h-ẽta. Dialect M is hoga.

Means '(I/my-) finger-belonging' (what belongs to my finger).
Refers to a 'hen's egg yolk', lit. 'yellow ancient' 15.690.
Refers to the fruit of a nut tree.
Means 'what is going to be bread'.
Refers to a 'flat cake of corn meal'.
Refers to a 'flat cake of corn meal'.
Also serves as expression for 'black'; cf. 15.650.
Respectively: 'to have a drink or nourishment (needs a syntactic complement); to have a meal'.
Respectively: 'to have a drink or nourishment (needs a syntactic complement); to have a meal'.
Latter example means 'ill spittle, snake venom'.
Latter example means 'ill spittle, snake venom'.
Also means 'to fall' 10.230, referring to the act of birth.
The man says aimẽno 'I took her'; the woman says čemẽno 'he took me'.
Respectively: adult word, also means 'push'; used with children and animals. See words for metal: 09.600-09.670.

The former also refers to 'bottom, underneath part'.
The former also refers to 'bottom, underneath part'.
Respectively: also means 'liver'; anatomical reference, from Span. 'corazón'. Traditionally the 'seat of being' is associated with the liver, pɨa 04.450.

Lit. '3p-wife-(perfective aspect)' means 'he has lost his wife'.
Lit. '3rd-husband-(perfective aspect)', means 'she has lost her husband'.
Traditional Chiriguano society did not distinguish between 'father' and 'father's brother'; brothers had the right to sleep also with their brother's wives.

Only used by women. Men do not distinguish between older and younger sisters.

Only used by men. Women do not distinguish between older and younger brothers.
Only used by men. Women do not distinguish between older and younger brothers.
Only used by men. Means 'my elder brother'.
Only used by the actual mother.
Also mẽ; mẽnã in M dialect.
Means 'rain-cloud'. Verbal form is ãma okɨ.
'Liquid' is tɨ-kʷe, as in 'juice, soup, milk' etc.
Original meaning is 'field cleared in the bush'.
The meaning is conveyed by verbal negation (suffix -a) and ǰepi 'sometimes, any time'.
Respectively: 'sweet; very, very sweet'. See next entry.
